The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Hopespear's Will
Hopespear's Will
Released 9 February 2022 (Update)
Members Yes
Quest series Dorgeshuun
Developer(s) John A (original), Mod Ed (Old School)

Hopespear's Will is a miniquest that involves assisting Hopespear, a goblin spirit, in returning the remains of the goblin high priests to Yu'biusk, the ancestral goblin homeland.

Contents

  • 1 Details
  • 2 Walkthrough
  • 3 Transcript
  • 4 Historical
  • 5 Trivia

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Speak to Hopespear in the crypt of the Goblin Temple
Official difficultyMaster
DescriptionUnknown edit
Official lengthShort
Requirements
  • Started The Restless Ghost
  • Completion of Desert Treasure
  • Completion of Fairytale II - Cure a Queen
  • Completion of Land of the Goblins
  • 50 Prayer (not boostable)
Items required
  • Ghostspeak amulet
  • Ring of visibility
  • Goblin potion
  • Dramen or lunar staff (unless the Lumbridge & Draynor Diary has been fully completed)
  • Food and potions to defeat 5 enemies without armour, weapons, or magic
Recommended
  • Combat Potions
  • 90 Combat level
  • Plain of mud sphere
  • Quick access to fairy rings
Enemies to defeat
  • Snothead (level 32)
  • Snailfeet (level 56)
  • Mosschin (level 88)
  • Redeyes (level 121)
  • Strongbones (level 184)
{"requirements":"* Started [[The Restless Ghost]]\n* Completion of [[Desert Treasure]]\n* Completion of [[Fairytale II - Cure a Queen]]\n* Completion of [[Land of the Goblins]]\n* <span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Prayer\" data-level=\"50\">[[File:Prayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 50 [[Prayer]]</span> <sup>(<span title=\"This requirement is not boostable\" style=\"cursor:help; text-decoration: underline dotted;\">not boostable</span>)</sup>","desc":"","difficulty":"Master","kills":"* [[Snothead]] (level 32)\n* [[Snailfeet]] (level 56)\n* [[Mosschin]] (level 88)\n* [[Redeyes]] (level 121)\n* [[Strongbones]] (level 184)","name":"Hopespear's Will","start":"Speak to [[Hopespear]] in the crypt of the [[Goblin Temple]]","length":"Short","items":"* [[Ghostspeak amulet]]\n* [[Ring of visibility]]\n* [[Goblin potion]]\n* [[Dramen staff|Dramen]] or [[lunar staff]] (unless the [[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary]] has been fully completed)\n* Food and potions to defeat 5 enemies without armour, weapons, or magic"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Head to the Goblin Cave entrance located just east of the Fishing Guild's entrance. Enter the cave and walk north, then west until you find two goblin guards guarding the entrance to the temple. Drink a dose of goblin potion and enter the temple. Do not equip the ghostspeak amulet and ring of visibility yet, or you will revert to human form and be expelled from the temple.

The crypt of the Goblin Temple.

Make your way to the crypt within the Goblin Temple, and once inside then equip the ghostspeak amulet and ring of visibility. You will see the ghost of Hopespear, the goblin prophet. Ask him why he is here, and he will tell you that he is waiting for the Big High War God to take his spirit to Yu'biusk.

Tell him that you have been to Yu'biusk, and he will ask you for a favour: to free the souls of the goblin high priests. To do this, you must complete a ritual which includes killing the goblin priests, without the use of weapons, spells, or armour, and retrieving their bones to be buried in Yu'biusk. Note: Wearing a Ring of recoil also counts as armour and will not let you receive the priest's bones upon defeat.

Remove any items you have equipped (you can keep the ghostspeak amulet and the ring of visibility equipped, however you must take off Morytania legs), then summon and battle the five high priests as done during Land of the Goblins. Unlike the quest, the high priests can be fought in any order.

You do not have to defeat all the high priests in one go; you can leave the crypt to restock, but note that you'll need additional doses of goblin potions.

Once players have all five bones of the high priests, they must use a fairy ring BLQ to reach Yu'biusk. Once you arrive there, bury the bones for a total of 38,750 Prayer experience.

Transcript[edit | edit source]

This article on a miniquest has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations encountered throughout the miniquest.

Historical[edit | edit source]

Hopespear's Will was released in RuneScape on 12 November 2007 alongside Land of the Goblins. Both this miniquest and its parent quest were extracted from the August 2007 Archive of RuneScape that Old School RuneScape is built off of. Compared to the original, the Old School version has a few differences:

  • Level 50 Prayer is required to start the miniquest, rather than level 40 in RuneScape.
  • The total amount of Prayer experience rewarded is 38,750, rather than 13,750 in RuneScape.
  • The goblin high priests are significantly stronger than their 2007 counterparts.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Hopespear's Will is the first miniquest from the original game to be ported to Old School RuneScape.

'''Hopespear's Will''' is a [[miniquest]] that involves assisting [[Hopespear]], a goblin spirit, in returning the remains of the goblin high priests to [[Yu'biusk]], the ancestral goblin homeland.

==Details==
{{Quest details

==Walkthrough==
[[File:Ghost (Hopespear) chathead.png|left]]
Head to the [[Goblin Cave]] entrance located just east of the [[Fishing Guild]]'s entrance. Enter the cave and walk north, then west until you find two [[Goblin guard (Land of the Goblins)|goblin guards]] guarding the entrance to the temple. Drink a dose of [[goblin potion]] and enter the temple. Do not equip the ghostspeak amulet and ring of visibility yet, or you will revert to human form and be expelled from the temple.
[[File:Goblin Temple crypt.png|thumb|280px|The crypt of the Goblin Temple.]]
Make your way to the crypt within the [[Goblin Temple]], and once inside then equip the [[ghostspeak amulet]] and [[ring of visibility]]. You will see the ghost of [[Hopespear]], the goblin prophet. Ask him why he is here, and he will tell you that he is waiting for the [[Big High War God]] to take his spirit to [[Yu'biusk]].

Tell him that you have been to [[Yu'biusk]], and he will ask you for a favour: to free the souls of the goblin high priests. To do this, you must complete a ritual which includes killing the goblin priests, without the use of weapons, spells, or armour, and retrieving their bones to be buried in Yu'biusk. '''Note: Wearing a [[Ring of recoil]] also counts as armour and will not let you receive the priest's bones upon defeat.''' 

Remove any items you have equipped (you can keep the ghostspeak amulet and the ring of visibility equipped, however you must take off [[Morytania legs 2|Morytania legs]]), then summon and battle the five high priests as done during [[Land of the Goblins]]. Unlike the quest, the high priests can be fought in any order. 

You do not have to defeat all the high priests in one go; you can leave the crypt to restock, but note that you'll need additional doses of [[goblin potion]]s. 

Once players have all five bones of the high priests, they must use a [[fairy ring]] {{fairycode|BLQ}} to reach [[Yu'biusk]]. Once you arrive there, bury the bones for a total of 38,750 [[Prayer]] experience.

==Transcript==
{{Hastranscript|miniquest}}

==Historical==
Hopespear's Will was released in ''RuneScape'' on [[12 November]] [[2007]] alongside Land of the Goblins. Both this miniquest and its parent quest were extracted from the [[August 2007 Archive of RuneScape]] that ''Old School RuneScape'' is built off of. Compared to the original, the ''Old School'' version has a few differences:
* Level 50 Prayer is required to start the miniquest, rather than level 40 in ''RuneScape''.
* The total amount of Prayer experience rewarded is 38,750, rather than 13,750 in ''RuneScape''.
* The goblin high priests are significantly stronger than their 2007 counterparts.

==Trivia==
* Hopespear's Will is the first miniquest from the original game to be ported to ''Old School RuneScape''.
